instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No image, turns on and hear sound - small liquid damage
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

had small liquid damage at <CHIP>U8501</CHIP>, so i replaced <CHIP>U8501</CHIP>, <CHIP>U8510</CHIP>,  <CHIP>U8500</CHIP>, did not work so i also replaced <CHIP>U8400</CHIP>, 

i tried a new display, and still nothing, 

it this helps any, the SMC had some damage coming from around PIN 161 (<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>)

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> is present by the way 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No image, turns on and hear sound - small liquid damage
threads.message:
So board woeks, only missing LCD image?
Did you check external video?
Any USB activity?

Probably damaged LCD output from CPU, after liquid spill near J8500...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No image, turns on and hear sound - small liquid damage
threads.message:
Logic board does work, image on external image works fine, USB works, 

doesn't look like had liquid damage at J8500
